dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hong Kong-based Insilico just published a paper in Nature Communications about their AI system, GENTRL, identifying five potential pulmonary fibrosis treatments in under a month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hong Kong-based Insilico just published a paper in Nature Communications about their A I system, G E N T R L, identifying five potential pulmonary fibrosis treatments in under a month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hong Kong-based Insilico Medicine published research Monday showing that its deep learning system could identify potential treatments for fibrosis. That system, called generative tensorial reinforcement learning, or GENTRL for short, was able to find six promising treatments in just 21 days, one of which showed promising results in an experiment involving mice. The research has been published in Nature Biotechnology, and the code for the model has been made available on Github.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and one of those candidates already showed promising results in rodent testing—that's pretty remarkable for such a short timeframe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and one of those candidates already showed promising results in rodent testing-that's pretty remarkable for such a short timeframe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That system, called generative tensorial reinforcement learning, or GENTRL for short, was able to find six promising treatments in just 21 days, one of which showed promising results in an experiment involving mice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the CEO, Alex Zhavoronkov, compared GENTRL to DeepMind's AlphaGo—you know, the system that beat Go champions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the C E O, Alex Zhavoronkov, compared G E N T R L to DeepMind's AlphaGo-you know, the system that beat Go champions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Weve got AI strategy combined with AI imagination, says Insilico CEO Alex Zhavoronkov, who compares the operation of GENTRL to the AlphaGo machine learning system that Googles Deepmind developed to challenge champion Go players.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, that's quite the comparison. And he mentioned they shifted their strategy after being inspired by Ian Goodfellow's work on generative models.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, that's quite the comparison. And he mentioned they shifted their strategy after being inspired by Ian Goodfellow's work on generative models.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shortly after founding the company, however, Zhavoronkov became fascinated with Ian Goodfellows work in machine learning, and decided to switch course.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Instead of just screening existing molecule libraries, they're having the AI design entirely new molecules with specific properties.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Instead of just screening existing molecule libraries, they're having the A I design entirely new molecules with specific properties.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We thought, Can we make machines imagine new molecules with particular properties instead of screening large vendor libraries? he says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is huge, because traditional drug discovery can take years and cost millions. Like that Genentech team spent almost a decade on this same target.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is huge, because traditional drug discovery can take years and cost millions. Like that Genentech team spent almost a decade on this same target.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The challenge was based on recently published research from a team at Genentech, which had taken about 8 years to identify promising DDR1 kinase inhibitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, DDR1 inhibition. Insilico's whole process—design, synthesis, validation—took about 48 days and cost around $160,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, DDR1 inhibition. Insilico's whole process-design, synthesis, validation-took about forty eight days and cost around one hundred sixty thousand dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It took about 21 days for the AI system to design molecules, and the total time for design, synthesis and validation was about 46 days. Although none of the drugs designed by GENTRL would appear to be more effective than inhibitors developed by the traditional research method, the traditional process to develop drug candidates took over 8 years and millions of dollars to develop - compared to the handful of weeks and approximate $150,000 cost of Insilicos method.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's… insane. But Zhavoronkov did admit their molecules weren't quite as effective as the ones from conventional research, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's... insane. But Zhavoronkov did admit their molecules weren't quite as effective as the ones from conventional research, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although none of the drugs designed by GENTRL would appear to be more effective than inhibitors developed by the traditional research method, the traditional process to develop drug candidates took over 8 years and millions of dollars to develop - compared to the handful of weeks and approximate $150,000 cost of Insilicos method.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but he pointed out it's experts versus an AI system built by people without deep chemistry backgrounds. Still, for a first pass? Impressive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but he pointed out it's experts versus an A I system built by people without deep chemistry backgrounds. Still, for a first pass? Impressive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But again thats years versus people who dont have a lot of knowledge of chemistry doing this stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they've raised over $27 million so far—investors are clearly paying attention to this fusion of AI and biotech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they've raised over twenty seven dollars million so far-investors are clearly paying attention to this fusion of A I and biotech.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Pitchbook, its so far raised $24.3 million in investment dollars at a valuation of $56 million, from backers including A-Level Capital and Juvenescence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Though he acknowledges this is just phase one. Clinical trials will take years, but it feels like a turning point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Though he acknowledges this is just phase one. Clinical trials will take years, but it feels like a turning point.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While this represents a milestone in demonstrating the potential of AI to identify drug candidates, it will still take years of clinical trials and millions spent on investigation before any drug candidate is approved for use to treat a particular disease.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. If this reduces skepticism in pharma about AI-driven discovery, that alone is a win.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. If this reduces skepticism in pharma about A I-driven discovery, that alone is a win.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I think that this paper will remove a lot of skepticism in big pharma, he says.
